meta.job_title: Driver - Mobile Van OTP (Opioid Treatment Program)

duties_responsibilities.duty: Drive company vehicles in a safe and conscientious manner complying with company policies and state transportation laws.
Interact with staff and patients in a professional manner, report any suspicious behavior to the Clinic Director and/or supervisors.
Monitor parking area to ensure no loitering or misconduct takes place, monitor the area to ensure safety and patient-compliance, and complete frequent sweeps around the entire unit.
Drive mobile unit to destination as scheduled and timely.
Assist patients as they get into and out of the vehicle.
Operate wheelchair lifts as needed when applicable.
Report traffic delays enroute back to supervisor.
Report any incidents or accidents to supervisor.
Complete daily visual of vehicle before and after each trip and report any problems in writing.
Check the vehicle to ensure there is an appropriate amount of fuel in the tank prior to leaving the facility.
Maintain accurate logbooks, including weekly, quarterly, and annual maintenance checks.
Maintain vehicle cleanliness and remove trash from the vehicle.
Schedule, organize, and coordinate vehicle maintenance and repair service shop appointments.
Comply with organizational policies, procedures, and performance improvement initiatives and maintain confidentiality.
Communicate clearly and effectively to patients and their family members, guests, and other members of the healthcare team.
Exhibit therapeutic rapport with patients maintaining professional boundaries, being respectful of personal space, and giving patients direct attention while maintaining rational detachment.
Develop constructive and cooperative working relationships with others and maintain them over time.
Encourage and build mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED equivalent
